name: places/ChIJg8cptfxYwokRRHRMVkhWMOo
formattedAddress: 575 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 575 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: I've been in and out of PT clinics for back issues for the last 10 years, and no place has made me feel more supported in my journey to a stronger, healthier body than Recovery PT. Leading up to my microdiscectomy, Bill eased my mind by explaining the procedure and recovery, and after having the surgery, he's worked diligently with me to build a strong treatment plan in the gym and on the PT table. The whole staff is both incredibly friendly and helpful, and it's easy to recognize that the treatment plans are carefully tailored to each individual patient to ensure optimal efficiency in terms of recovery. Bill has gone above and beyond in dealing with my injuries, purchasing books on unique therapy techniques and equipment to help with stretching/building strength, all the while being a joy to work with. Bill, Nina and Allen are all wonderful therapists, and Leticia and Davey take great care in making the patient on-boarding and scheduling process easy and stress-free. I'd recommend Recovery PT Midtown East to anyone looking to relieve pain and learn how to maintain a healthy lifestyle!

originalText.text:
In January of 2018 I finished my therapy session with Recovery Physical Therapy at the Midtown East location at 575 Lexington Avenue. I had rotator cuff surgery and a biceps reattachment back in August of 2017 and after a sleep deprived month in a sling I met with Kim Meyers, the director of the office, who came highly recommended by my doctor who performed the operation.

I was very apprehensive at the idea of letting anyone move my left arm after all the surgery that was done, but Kim was very responsive to how I was feeling. Always working delicately to make sure I was comfortable but also making sure that I keep the muscles  loose and strengthened as much as possible. She was very knowledgeable about the work that was done to my shoulder and bicep and kept me well informed of what motions I should and should not be performing during my recovery. She kept me updated with exercises I was to perform daily at home or in the gym to help strengthen the muscles as I began to recover. At my doctor's visits  I always showed great progress, and he always marveled at how quickly I was recovering visit to visit. This was of course because I followed Kim's instructions and was diligent about performing my exercises. They were tough to perform at first as the repaired muscles were weak from lack of use, but I always felt better afterwards. If I did not exercise I would feel them stiffen up.

After my last visit in January I started to get back to my old lifting and cardio routines, with the knowledge (from Kim) that I am nearing forty and have to pay attention to my form and posture now more than ever.A year after surgery my strength is almost back to were it was before the injury. I can thank her today that I can hold my baby son comfortably and safely thanks to the work Kim did to get my shoulder back into shape. I would not hesitate to recommend working with Kim for any physical therapy needs.
